abstract.p: SGS is a set of subroutines for performing low-level graphics input/output. SGS is implemented above the GKS package (described in SUN/83, the RAL GKS Guide and the ISO document GKS 7.4) which is a device independent graphics system designed to be the kernel of a wide variety of graphics systems. GKS, which is very comprehensive, does not itself set out to provide the most convenient interfaces for all applications, and SGS allows easy access to many of its more straightforward features.

SGS, while preserving GKS concepts and indeed allowing direct GKS calls to be interspersed with SGS calls, is optimised for convenience in simple cases. Many of its features are low level (for example: open, draw a line, draw a text string, close), but there are some routines of a slightly higher level (drawing arcs and formatted numbers etc). SGS does not include routines for high level operations like drawing annotated axes or complete graphs.
